Post_Title: Do most adults realize/remember that kids need to be TAUGHT how to do things?
post_text:
Not sure why I was thinking about this today, but - I remember when I was a kid I didn't know how to do things that I guess seem like they "should" be obvious, but... realized that they're probably only obvious when you know how to do them, and a kid would have to be taught. And I wasn't. I just had to figure stuff out, or do things wrong and be ridiculed for it. 

For example I distinctly remember not knowing how to hand wash dishes, I just sort of submerged them in the sink full of soapy water and swished them around and figured "Yeah, that looks like what's happening when people wash dishes, that must be how it goes" I didn't realize you had to scrub them or anything. I was probably too young to be asked to wash the dishes in the first place, but either way no one actually taught me. Or I remember not knowing how to dry off after taking a shower for whatever reason, I'd just sort of huddle under a towel while I ended up mostly air-drying. I felt like an idiot for stuff like that for a long time, but... I was just a kid. Kids need to be taught things.

And of course now I still assume I need to figure everything out myself and hate asking for help with anything lol.
